Function Documentation

void cuda::free ( const DevicePtr &  ptr  ) 

Free device memory.

Parameters:
ptr a device pointer returned by a previous call to malloc or malloc2D.
DevicePtr cuda::malloc ( unsigned int  size  ) 

Allocate device memory.

The allocated memory is is suitably aligned for any kind of variable. The memory is not cleared.

Parameters:
size the number of bytes to allocate
Returns:
a device pointer to the newly allocated memory
DevicePtr cuda::malloc2D ( unsigned int &  pitch,
unsigned int  widthBytes,
unsigned int  height,
unsigned int  elementSize 
)

Allocate device memory with pitch.

Allocate at least widthBytes * height bytes of linear memory on the device. The allocation may be padded to meet the alignment requirements for coalescing as the address is updated from row to row.

elementSize specifies the size of the largest reads and writes that will be performed on the memory range. elementSize may be 4, 8 or 16 (since coalesced memory transactions are not possible on other data sizes). If elementSizeBytes is smaller than the actual read/write size of a kernel, the kernel will run correctly, but possibly at reduced speed.

The pitch returned is guaranteed to work with 2D copies under all circumstances.

Parameters:
pitch a reference where to store the pitch
widthBytes the width of the allocation, in bytes
height the height of the allocation
elementSize the largest read/write size to/from this memory (4, 8 or 16 bytes).
Returns:
a device pointer to the newly allocated memory
void cuda::memcpy ( void *  dest,
const DevicePtr &  src,
unsigned int  len,
const Stream &  stream 
)

Copy from device memory to host memory asynchronously.

Works only with page locked host memory.

Parameters:
dest the destination memory pointer
src the source memory pointer
len the number of bytes to copy
stream the stream to associate the operation with
